Metadata.Title: How to Create a Temporary X.509 Certificate for Transport Security
Metadata.DirectLink: How to Create a Temporary X.509 Certificate for Transport Security
Metadata.Priority: J.D. Meier, Jason Taylor, Prashant Bansode, Carlos Farre, Madhu Sundararajan, Rob Boucher, Steve Gregersen

Content.Data:
Applies to

  • Microsoft® Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) 3.5
  • Microsoft Visual Studio® 2008

Description

Use the following steps to create a temporary X.509 certificate for transport security:

  1. Create a certificate to act as your Root Certificate Authority 
      makecert -n "CN=RootCATest" -r -sv RootCATest.pvk RootCATest.cer
  2. Install your Root Certificate Authority on the server and client machines. Use MMC to install the RootCATes.cer on client and server machines in the Trusted Root Certification Authorities store
  3. Create and install your temporary service certificate 
      makecert -sk keyName -iv RootCATest.pvk -n "CN=MachineName.domain.com" -ic RootCATest.cer -sr localmachine -ss my -sky exchange -pe
  4. Use Inetmgr to configure the web site and virtual directory to use the certificate and to require SSL to secure communication

Additional Resources

  • For more information see “Certificate Creation Tool (Makecert.exe)“ at http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bfsktky3(VS.80).aspx
